title: Don’t Expect ‘Eyes of Wakanda’ to Just Be a ‘Black Panther’ Show
description: The showrunner of the upcoming Marvel animated show talks about what's coming to Disney+ in August.

title: Jussie Smollett Donates $50,000 to Arts Center to Settle Chicago’s Lawsuit
description: Although the actor’s conviction for filing a false police report was overturned because of a previous deal with prosecutors, the city wanted him to pay for its hate crime investigation.

title: What Is Swedish Culture? An Attempt to Answer Stirs Debate.
description: Is it Abba? Saunas? Plays by Strindberg? A government initiative to define an official cultural canon has unsettled many in the arts scene.

title: Free Concerts, Festivals and Events in New York This Summer
description: When the weather gets warm, there are hundreds of ways to have a good time in the city without laying down any cash. Here are some of our favorites.

title: As George Lucas’s ‘Starship’ Museum Nears Landing, He Takes the Controls
description: The ‘Star Wars’ director parted ways with the museum’s top boss and is clearly calling the shots as his Museum of Narrative Art in Los Angeles approaches completion.

title: How a High Line Curator Keeps Up With Art in Multiple Cities
description: Cecilia Alemani works on public art for the popular greenway in addition to curating shows in New York and Santa Fe. This is what a few days in her life look like.

title: Robert Campbell, Architecture Critic in Love With Boston, Dies at 88
description: A Pulitzer Prize winner, he wrote with humanity and zest for The Boston Globe for more than 40 years.

title: How Sex and Religion Collided in 1980s Culture
description: Madonna, Scorsese, Warhol and “Piss Christ” play roles in Paul Elie’s maybe-too-comprehensive look at how divisive expressions of faith came to the fore.

title: Tony Bechara, Painter Who Championed Latino Artists, Dies at 83
description: He turned away from a potential career in the law or international relations to produce abstract paintings, and he headed El Museo del Barrio.

title: Corrections: May 25, 2025
description: Corrections that appeared in print on Sunday, May 25, 2025.

title: Dandy Attire for a Night at the Opera
description: Looking the part of a gentleman in a double-breasted blazer and pleated trousers.

title: Jimmy Kimmel on Trump: ‘Celebrated the first two letters of Memorial Day this weekend’
description: Late-night host discussed Donald Trump’s self-involved Memorial Day posts, a rambling commencement address and his snub of his own crypto buyers

title: Sudden Fear: the 1952 noir that cemented Joan Crawford’s star – again
description: With this tale of love turned sour, Crawford forged an unprecedented Hollywood archetype: the now-prevalent actor-turned-executive producer

title: ‘The fandom was rock’n’roll. Sophie Ellis-Bextor loved our rap song!’’ How we made Balamory
description: ‘The theme tune was originally “What’s the Story in Tobermory?” But there was a Womble called Tobermory. So a researcher in the Gaelic department came up with Balamory’

title: ‘She’s been talking about it all year’: school at Derbyshire festival gets top grades from children
description: School at Bearded Theory festival allows parents to enrol children without incurring fines for absences

title: ‘A steamy wrestle’: Guardian article inspires play on Shakespeare and Marlowe collaboration
description: Exclusive: Born With Teeth by Liz Duffy Adams, coming to West End, imagines rival dramatists working together
